Review Title: Good place to have a bath
Review Text: This Falls is located in the  Thudugala Estate in Thudugala village at Kalutara District, Sri Lanka. Once owned by a British national, a derelict bungalow still remains near the waterfall. There is a natural swimming pool which even kids can use.

Tudugala Waterfall is located in the village of Tudugala in the Dodangoda village in the Western Province of the Kalutara District.To visit Tudugala Falls, one can easily take a tuk tuk or family vehicle . When you visit Tudugala Falls you have to go through a rubber plantation. The ruins of an old bungalow can also be seen as you continue along the small footpath.As we continue along that trail we can hear the sound of the waterfall well.This waterfall consists of two deep and shallow areas.During periods of heavy rainfall, a large mass of water flows through the falls.Actually this water is very clean and very cold.Bathing in the cool waters of the falls gives you an unforgettable experience. I think it's best to take your food and drink with you when you visit the falls. Because the number of shops and facilities around it is minimal.It is best to go at a less crowded time to have the most peaceful experience. During the holidays, a considerable number of people visit this place. If you want to have a good experience, be more careful about it.
Nice and cool water fall. a Place to See different kind of small fishes from there. to swim and have a little crunk its is a good place.

We hired a taxi with another couple to visit a few places nearby, including the waterfall. It is very nice and also popular with locals. It's free to climb up by the waterfall, but there is a dodgy bridge half way. Something to do if you want to visit the local area.

This hidden gem of the west was known to me courtesy TripAdvisor (thank you). The falls are picturesque,  the water is so cool you could just live on it forever. The downside was that some people who had come for a dip were taking drinks which is unsafe for both themselves and killed the serenity of the moment in my opinion because we were with kids. San that, the falls are a go to and I'd be happy to visit it over and over again

Review Title: Thudugala Ella near to starting point
Review Text: Sunbathing at Thudugala Ella Kaluthara, Sri Lanka. Better to hired TukTuk and visit Waterfall starting point. No peoples are used to travel to starting point. Kind of a hiding place. I have been visited last month with my friend. We drive our own TukTuk All the way from wadduwa. Took 30 minutes. You can see few small villages on the way to the Thudugala Ella Waterfall. As a local I enjoyed much. Thudugala Ella is nearest Waterfall to the sea level. It's very easy to climb Waterfall because now there not much water. It is safe and can see many things about Waterfall

We went on a Tuesday from Kalutara hotels by tuk tuk (30 minutes and 1000 rupees each way) and found the place deserted. It is a bit of a scramble up the path climbing up next to the falls, but any able bodied person can make it. The more adventurous of our party ignored the path and climbed up the boulders in the river. They saw a snake sunbathing. The top pool is deep enough to swim in, with rounded boulders under the water, which is clean and so cool after the climb. The only fault is the rubbish left by some people; I guess it is never cared for by the locals / government. Well recommend though, as it was a day out without being hassled to buy stuff

Thank you #Trip Adviser. This place is very ideal for a one day trip. 1 hour from Colombo, if you take the Highway. Can do a little hiking as well. And the area is green and pretty. People have littered the place as usual, which is very disappointing. There can be a little problem with Vehicle parking, so better go earlier. :) Couples can enjoy leisurely.

Review Title: Combine a visit to the Castle
Review Text: Sri Lanka has hundreds of waterfalls and this is one to visit and enjoy in full flow. It is a bit of a walk from the car park but is is worth  visiting
Visited here in conjunction with trip to Richmond castle. Not a bit area to swim in. Would be crowded if more than 10 people visited. Spectacular all the same

It is one of the easier accessible waterfall for the people living close to Colombo. Clean water. You need to park your vehicle beside the main road and walk about 200 meters inside. You walk past a tea factory and an abandoned old building. Nice surrounding. Beware of leeches. They would crawl in an instant. Nice waterfall to have a bath. Weekends are usually crowded, specially during the noon.

A nice little trip to fill an hour or two. Easy to get to in a 3 wheeler nice abandoned buildings on the way to the fall and the rubber trees. It's unfortunate that there was little stacks of rubbish on the way and some slippery spots so be careful but a cool spot to check out.
Very nice stopover point enroute to Nuwara Elliya. Approach to the waterfall is a bit slippery and not recommended for small childrern!

Great natural beauty of nature, can be reached without much hassle through a rubber plantation and small forest. So beautiful and existing highck upto the falls. Due rain the rock surfaces are very sliperry and extremely dangerous at some places. There are leeches and some visitors haver littered the area. Must visit ðŸ˜‰

The water level of this small waterfall recedes continuously due to activities carried around its sourcing areas. This is the closest waterfall to the sea in Sri Lanka. Visited and polluted by locals on weekends and holidays.

We went to the waterfall on a weekday, which I would recommend because it is more quiet then. It takes +- 30 minutes to get to the location from Kalutara and 5 minutes to walk to the actual waterfalls. You can go by busses but we hired a tuktuk/threewheeler. The lower part is easily accesable and for the top it takes a slightly steeper climb for 5 minutes. Unfortunately there is a lot of garbage at the lower falls so I would go to the top ones.
Quite a way off the beaten track but pretty once you get there. Was able to get in and cool off in the cooling water.

My friend and I hired a tuk-tuk driver to take us there. It was approximately a twenty minute journey with pleasant scenery. The walk into the waterfall is short - five minutes but a bit of a scramble so I suggest wearing runners. Unfortunately there's quite a bit of rubbish along the way. The waterfall was lovely, even though it hadn't rained in the past week.
Any one can go there with in few minutes from Kalutara city. The nearest waterfall to Kalutara city.
We walked through the rubber plantation to get there and swam in the pools. After a visit to Richmond palace

We visited whilst out and about, not rainy season so not as much water as normal, but still worth visiting as was great. Steps down are very steep and once you are down not much space but we had the place to ourselves so couldn't complain and got some nice pictures. You can go down and take a dip but we didn't bother as we had other things to see and do.
I liked this place and you can enjoy bathing and natural waterfall for free in this palace. Enjoyed the trip on here

This place is very easy to access. Only a 5 minutes walk from the vehicle park. Along the way you can see a old rubber factory building which is now closed. Water is clean and too much crowd in weekends and holidays. You can have a nice bath from both top and bottom of the fall. Some are sliding along the water fall. But I don't recommending it. Top of the waterfall there is a natural cave on the left side.

We Tuk Tuk,ed from Mermaid Hotel to visit. On way we saw the vast Rubber Plantation and disused factory. We went on a Sunday, and it was quite busy with locals. They left us after 20 minutes in total peace to enjoy.  Great just lying in the water chillin ........ Told its best after rainfall. Watch out for Monkeys in trees as you leave.  They are about. A Kilometer or two along the road on right hand side. Great Fun.

I went with  my  friends  by bike, it's  took  us about  half an hour  from Kalutara.  Nice small  and  quiet waterfall. We enjoyed  our  time  a  lot. Fresh water, lovely  sound of  water and  birds. Good  place to  relax.
Nice place for spent over free time.. beautiful sound we were hearing here. Some people dropped plastics and inorganic items here. I would like to say to travelers keep cleanly this places.
this is a great day out, we saw  4 blue whales it was fabulous, then went for lunch in Galle , Not too great, but on the way back to Kalutara  we called at a turtle hatchery, such a treat!
if you visit Sri lanka you will find out that there is not much of the attractions there - but this one is worth to go to and take pictures

We visited the waterfall last week as it was close to our hotel, about a 30 minute walk. No one at the hotel knew about the waterfall, which was surprising as it was one of a few in the area, with this being the biggest. It is tucked away behind an old rubber tree plantation house but in the middle of a rubber tree nursery with over 40,000 trees being grown. You walk down a small track and follow the noise of the water as there are no signs posted. As you get near the waterfall, you can hear the water running fast through the bushes and trees. Theres two parts, the lower part is pretty flat, but another 100m walk up the river reveals a secluded deeper waterfall where you can bathe in shallow water. Recommendation Dont go during holidays as the locals swamp the place, especially POYA day. Take lots of water as there are no jungle shops, and sun cream.
great place to visit - true Sri Lanka away from the beach. Quite a steep walk but well worth it. not too much water right now so able to access closer.

We visited couple of times. The Thudugala Ella waterfall is located in the Thudugala village in Dodangoda Divisional Secretariat in Kalutara District of Western Province, Sri Lanka. Out of around 382 recorded waterfalls in Sri Lanka, the rank of this is 268th.
